description: From French reconnoître (obsolete spelling of reconnaître), from Latin recognoscere (“to recognize”). Contrarily, there is also an obsolete 19th-century British English spelling reconnaitre (now reconnoitre).

entries.meaning: (American spelling) An act or instance of reconnoitering.
examples: The pilot reported the findings of his reconnoiter.

verbs.description: reconnoiter (third-person singular simple present reconnoiters, present participle reconnoitering, simple past and past participle reconnoitered)

entries.meaning: (American spelling, transitive, intransitive, military) To perform a reconnaissance (of an area; an enemy position); to scout with the aim of acquiring information.
examples: Our scout will reconnoiter the path ahead of our troops.
